name: biomni-model-protein-dimerization-network
title: Biomni: Model Protein Dimerization Network
description: Model protein dimerization networks to find equilibrium concentrations of dimers using ODE-based simulation
content:
Overview

Model protein dimerization networks to predict equilibrium concentrations of protein dimers using ODE-based kinetic simulation. This tool simulates the dynamic formation and dissociation of protein dimers in complex networks, calculating steady-state concentrations based on binding affinities and initial monomer concentrations.

Input Parameters

  • monomer_concentrations (dict, required): Dictionary mapping protein names to their initial monomer concentrations (in Î¼M or nM)
  • dimerization_affinities (dict, required): Dictionary of binding affinities (Kd values) for each protein pair
  • network_topology (dict, required): Network structure defining which proteins can form dimers (protein pair relationships)

Input Format

{
  "monomer_concentrations": {
    "ProteinA": 10.0,
    "ProteinB": 5.0,
    "ProteinC": 8.0
  },
  "dimerization_affinities": {
    "A-B": 0.1,
    "A-C": 0.5,
    "B-C": 0.2
  },
  "network_topology": {
    "dimers": [["ProteinA", "ProteinB"], ["ProteinA", "ProteinC"], ["ProteinB", "ProteinC"]]
  }
}

Biological Use Case

This tool is valuable for systems biology applications including:

  • Modeling protein-protein interaction networks in signal transduction pathways
  • Predicting dimer formation in transcription factor complexes (e.g., Jun-Fos heterodimers)
  • Analyzing competitive binding scenarios in multi-protein systems
  • Studying receptor dimerization in membrane signaling (e.g., cytokine receptors, growth factor receptors)
  • Understanding dynamic equilibria in scaffold protein assemblies
  • Investigating the effects of protein concentration changes on complex formation

Output

The simulation provides:

  • Equilibrium concentrations for all dimers in the network
  • Remaining free monomer concentrations at steady state
  • Time-course dynamics showing how the system reaches equilibrium
  • Binding equilibrium analysis and mass balance verification

Results are saved to 'dimerization_network_results.txt' in the specified output directory.

Category

systems_biology
